page.title: 13THE PUBS IN THE AREA 1
page.content: There is a long tradition of public houses in the area. Perhaps it is a response to the industrial traditions, where people engaged in heavy industry need to drink to escape from hard repetitive physical labour. There are seven pubs in the area and in their way they reflect the changes being wrought upon new town communities. They are also the only sources of local entertainment. Each has its own character; though they can be divided into two groups: the 'locals' and 'service' pubs. The locals, 'The Foresters Arms', 'Travellers' Joy', the 'Cheshire Cheese', and the 'White Horse', are all committed to serving their 'locals', offering entertainment, sport, and cameraderie with their pub teams in darts, pool and snooker, football and dominoes.
